value.title: Why Didn't Artificial Intelligence Save Us From Covid-19?
value.excerpt: In late January, more than a week before Covid-19 had been given that name, hospitals in Wuhan, China, began testing a new method to screen for the disease, using artificial intelligence. The plan involved chest CTs—three-dimensional scans of lungs displayed in finely detailed slices.
